oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Sparta Spoke Factory
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Interior of Sparta Spoke Factory. Shown are employees and equipment.

J.R. Tubb, Senior, founded Sparta Spoke Factory in 1896. It became the world's largest producer of wooden spokes. As the need for wooden spokes decreased, focus shifted to making other hardwood components. The company is still in business today as Sparta WoodWorks, which manufactures custom furniture components and specialty products.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Looking Back at Tennessee Photograph Collection, 1890-1981
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Lumber industry; Lumber; Employees; Machinery
